text: Practice Problem 2.3 (solution page 180) A single byte can be represented by 2 hexadecimal digits. Fill in the missing entries in the following table, giving the decimal, binary, and hexadecimal values of different byte patterns: Decimal Binary — Hexadecimal 0 0000 0000 0x00 158 76 145 — 10101110 0 00111100 e 1111 0001
